New Records: Jason Holder took a double hat-trick, becoming the fourth man to achieve four wickets in four balls in a T20 international
Key Match Events: Jason Holder took four wickets in four balls to end England's hopes
Akeal Hosein took 4-24 and ripped the guts from England's reply
Kieron Pollard and Rovman Powell shared a destructive partnership
Pre-Game Insights: The series decider was played on the same pitch on which Rovman Powell had run riot on Wednesday
Kieron Pollard chose to bat due to the low-scoring opener and pitches taking more spin under lights
Post-Match Reflections: England's defeat has exposed some areas which need attention just nine months out from the T20 World Cup, not least their death bowling
Jason Holder was named player of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: The West Indies innings was two-paced, starting brightly, grinding to a half when Moeen Ali turned to spin, then accelerating with a late burst when the seamers came back on
England's reply got off to a bad start with Jason Roy caught off his boot and Tom Banton miscuing Odean Smith to midwicket
Others: Since losing to India at home in 2018, England had lost one in 11 bilateral T20 series, in India in 2020-21
England's captain Moeen Ali posted a stodgy 14 off 19 balls before picking out Holder again
